RULES.RULE: Overview • Resolve the clues based on physics / maths. • Test your blind coding skills (C Programming). • Decode the circuits. • Grease up your hands, grind your tools.

General rules:  Four contestants per team.  No usage of mobiles.  Exceeding time limit for any task will lead to point deduction.  Further rules will be informed during the task.  In case of any disputes/discrepancies, the organizers decision will be final and binding.

Instruction • PlayStation 4 console will be provided along with controllers. • Each half of the match will be of 5 minutes. • If a match ends with a draw, the results will be decided by penalty shootouts. • 2 minutes will be given for setting up the teams.

Each team must prepare a PPT (Presentation); The time limit is 8 minutes. Exceeding time will result in negative marking. • After presenting judges will ask questions to the participants in the Q and A session. • Other participants are prohibited from asking questions as it's incompetent. • Participants are allowed to get prototypes; these will fetch more points. Judges decisions are final and binding. • Any vulgarity will not be tolerated and will result in instant disqualification.
Judging criteria: 1. Uniqueness 2. Financial feasibility 3. Creativity 4. Relevance 5. Confidence

Rules: 1) The subjects or scenes clicked should be in college campus and surroundings. 2) No use drones or action cams are allowed (only use of mobile or Dslr or mirrorless cameras are allowed) 3) Photo’s submission should be done before the given time. 4) participants have to send their photos in doc format (with file name as their name along with participation number.) 5) No editing is allowed 6) The allotted time for capturing the photos is 2 hours. 7) Two topics will be given on the spot, one photo from each topic

The decision of the coordinator will be the final decision in case of any Discrepancies. They hold the right to change the rules to promote fair play, Sportsmanship, and to ensure that all competitors have an enjoyable competition, For any queries contact the coordinators

Rules: • Each team will have one bot and can comprise of a maximum of 4 members. • Bots can be Wireless (Bluetooth controlled or RC, etc.) or wired. • Bot specification (maximum): Bot weight below 15 kg no tolerance. Length and width of the bot= 40cm+10% tolerance, Operating voltage=24V. • For students making wired bots, they have to get their own extension boards and students making wireless bots should bring their own batteries etc. (Participants should get their own components and power tools) • Participants should keep spare batteries, otherwise It may lead to disqualification, if bot is not ready or Stops in between the match • No weapons allowed (like external gears, cutters, etc). • No moving parts should be allowed. • The length of the wire (for wired bots) should be Long enough to cover the whole arena and wire Should remain slack during the complete game. • The competition shall consist of 3 rounds each of 1 minute. • In case of a tie, there will be a extended match where there will be a time limit of 1mins add on. • The team with maximum points will be declared as the winner. • In case of any disputes/discrepancies, the organizer’s Decision will be final and binding. • All decisions about scoring, Game Play and timing, And participation, made by the Organizing Committee Is final. • Teams should completely respect their vote and Decisions. • “At any point judges decision is the final Decision”

Bot specifications- The overall specifications of the bot must not exceed the following (including tolerance): - 28 cm in length - 22 cm in width, - 20 cm in overall height 2kg in total weight. - No Lego and ready-made bot. - Max voltage 12V • The competition will be of 2 rounds. Round 1 shall be a qualifier round and round 2 shall be the final round. • In round 1, every team will be given 2-time trials. Best out of the 2 given trial will be judged. • For the 1st trial of first round, a test run of 3 minutes will be given after which immediately it will start. • Team should give 2nd and final trial immediately after 1st trial. There won't be any TEST RUN for 2nd trial. • The bot must cover the entire track within 4 minutes to qualify for the final round. • Any shortcut paths and deviation from the main line will lead to placing of the bot back to the nearest check point. • Coordinator’s decision will be the final one. • In case if no bot is able to complete the track of first round in given time, top 5 bots covering maximum checkpoints will be shortlisted for the final round. • Width of the line will be 3cm. The participants shall be informed in prior by the event coordinators if there is any change in the width of the line. • The track will be black line on white background or white line on black background. • The Line Follower Bot must be fully self-driven and must not be externally operated by wire or remote radio control during the course of the race. • Before commencement of the actual race, the teams will be allowed to test their bots on the track but only for limited period of time as decided by the coordinators. • Once the bot is placed on the track, a maximum of 8 touches will be allowed to reset the bot on the right track and a penalty of 5 sec per touch shall be added to the total time. • No checkpoint can be skipped. • Winner shall be the group whose bot manages to finish the track in the shortest amount of time. In case no team manages to finish the track, then the prize shall be given to the team who completes most part of the track in shortest time.

Rules and Regulations: • Theme: How Technology Saves Life. • Duration: Maximum 8 Minutes. • Films exceeding this time limit are liable to be rejected. Only one short film per college is permitted. • Exact remake of the movie is not allowed. • Use of abusive and vulgar language or content is strictly prohibited and would lead to direct disqualification. • Films submitted previously to any other events will not be considered for the contest. • Decision of the judges will be final and binding on all participants • The film can be in either of the languages that are English, Hindi, Marathi and Konkani but must be compulsorily subtitled in English.
While registering for TECH CINEMA, only team leader must register their name and no limit on the number of people participating in the film.

Judging Criteria: • Creativity • Adherence to the theme • Acting skills • Cinematography • Editing • You can submit the entries in .MP4, Full HD 16:9 format with a maximum file size of 1GB. • Entry submission should be via email:rashmitshirodkar1@gmail.com before 10:00 am on 12th April 2023

CSGO Rules and Regulations General ● The event will be a conducted in the New SAC. ● Each team will consist of 5 players only. ● Counter-Strike Global Offensive will be played. ● Contestants are expected to bring their own Wired Headphones and Gaming Mouse if needed. ● Computers will be provided for playing the game. ● Teams are expected to be on time. ● The teams knocked out will be ranked according to the number of rounds won. ● If there is a tie in the teams knocked out, the score of the highest person would be the tie-breaker. ● All games will be recorded and final scorecard’s screenshots taken.
Game Rules
● Quarter-Finals will be best of one-map, Semi-Finals and Finals will be best of three maps. ● Each map will be best of 10 rounds, 2 minutes round time and 45 second bomb timer. ● Map Pool for Quarters is de_Dust2, de_Inferno and de_Cache. ● Map Pool for the Semis and Finals includes de_Mirage and de_Nuke. ● Map to be played will be decided by the Veto System. ● Knife round will determine the starting side of a team. ● Id cards should be carried for verification throughout the event and any unethical behaviour will not be tolerated. ● Steam accounts will be provided and will not be allowed to login due to time constraint. ● All maps from official map pool.

General Rules: The topic will be given on the same day • Languages - English, Hindi, Marathi, Konkani • Each team to be ready and seated in the debate hall before scheduled start time. • Each team will be given a total of 8 mins for which includes: 6-7 mins of constructive speech. 1-2 mins of rebuttal. • All the members of the team should speak. • A warning bell will be given 1 min prior to the final bell for each team. • After all teams have finished making their points, the judges will ask questions to each team. • Marks will be deducted on exceeding the time limit. • Use of disrespectful language, personal comments is strictly prohibited and negative marking or disqualification will be applied. • The decision of the judges and the organizing committee will be final and binding. • The teams will be judged on: Content, confidence, arguments and rebutting skills
NOTE: - First 14 registration will be selected
Rules: • VPN, EMULATOR, CONTROLLER, and TRIGGERS are prohibited. • Each team should consist of Minimum 5 players. • Only 1 substitute is allowed. • Players should get their own accessories.

IN GAME RULES: • Battles played will be best of 3. • Final match played will be best of 5. • Modes:  SEARCH AND DESTROY  HARDPOINT  DOMINATION • Maps: o FIRING RANGE o SUMMIT o STANDOFF • All Guns, Operator, Score streaks and Perks are allowed. • If any player disconnects during a match, the game continues. • The player must try to reconnect as soon as possible. • Failing to reconnect, the coordinators are not responsible for it.
TOPIC: GK, technology, current affairs, science, entertainment, sports, Indian heritage, classical music, literature

INSTRUCTIONS: • There will be 3 rounds in the competition and based on the participation numbers the elimination will be decided accordingly. • In case of a tie, bonus question will be asked which won't have any points. • Use of cell phones/any other device and browsing the internet is strictly prohibited. • Rules and regulation will be given on the day of the event. • Quiz Master's and Coordinators decision will be final and binding.

Rules: • You have to build a website using any web building framework in 6 hours. • You have to bring your own laptop. • Internet will be provided to you. • Copy pasting code from any platform, without proper understanding of that code is not allowed. • Points are given on basis of quality of code, database and design. • Vulnerabilities in backend will reduce your points. • Topic will be provided on the day of the event.
